context: Pharmacists are <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>healthcare<a0_1/> professionals<b5_0/><a0_0/> with <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b8_0>specialised education<a0_2/> and training<b8_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> who perform various roles to ensure <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>optimal<a1_1/> health outcomes<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_0/> for their patients through the quality use of medicines. Pharmacists may also be <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>small-business proprietors<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, owning the pharmacy in which they practice. Since pharmacists know about the mode of action of a particular drug, and its metabolism and physiological effects on the human body in great detail, they play an important role in <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b9_0>optimisation of a drug treatment<a2_1/> for an individual<b9_0/><a2_2/><a2_0/>.
